intro: Scolymocephalus incomptus, commonly known as the slender water plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist or wet environments, such as marshes and stream banks. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Scolymocephalus incomptus is native to parts of Europe and has been introduced to other regions where it can thrive in similar habitats.
